column4: Definitely a great experience. A lot of money has been put in to this museum.. It is HUGE and has a lot of history. I took my daughter there for a school trip and had a blast! If you're from Saskatoon and are looking to get away from your iPhone for a few minutes, check it out!

We really enjoyed our first visit to the Saskatoon WDM, including the visiting exhibit on the history of video games. The regular exhibits on the history of the province and especially of agriculture are first-rate. It's a great place to lose yourself in the past.

A fun museum and it has been a staple of the city for as many years as I can remember. A neat small town setup, cool items and they have enough to do there to keep busy for a couple hours.Best part, it is apparently haunted. Ghost sightings are regular! Check it out!

Must visit if you are with kids - super entertaining and interactive. Lots of info on west territories growth and development. Great samples of agriculture equipment. And you feel how important is the community in your life.
Just left the museum. Not too big but lots to see about the history of Saskatchewan. Well worth the $10 admission.
Was visiting Saskatoon over weekend and ended up visiting here - really great setting and immersive experience, loved it!
Awesome place to see and be apart of. Too much walking for the seniors we were with but they loved it too.

After driving by the museum more times then you could count we finally decided to venture in.On the day we went there were a number of school children going through the displays.While lots of the stuff on display predates my generation, there were still many things I recall using as a child. Hearing the kids comments about the...
this is a great place to take the family young and old lots of history and heritage here and u must have the pancakes at the restaurant
We go as a group for Breakfast..Self serve but so scrumptious.You will not be disappointed to do there!!

The Western Development Museum is a lovely location to host such events. The created realistic town is a wonderful backdrop to all of the beautiful trees and Christmas decorating. The festival helps you to get into the Christmas spirit. Another favourite is all the gingerbread houses.If you have never been to the museum it is an excellent time to...
Place looked great had a lot of fun and learned a few things too. Staff was very nice and they had a in house artist painting and a book author signing as well.

Great museum about the settlement of the prairies. There is an old town main street re-creation based on 1910. Shops often have volunteer staff for an air of friendly authenticity. The working blacksmith shop on Sundays is a must see.

When we visited the western development museum I found it very well displayed and set up. It had a lot of artifacts in every part of the old western town displays. I totally enjoyed the railroad engine display. Found the whole museum with gift shop and food outlet very good value for the price of admission.
A great record of Saskatchewan s history .I found things I didn't know even though born and raised in Saskatchewan
An excellent insight into early Saskatchewan, Bonus are the fantastic old cars and the miniature farm displays

I hadn't gone in 30+ years and then we went a while ago. It was interesting to see things that they have in the boomtown display. It is a far cry from today when they have fireplaces heating the water for horses downtown Saskatoon
Great place to visit whether you live in Saskatoon or are here for a visit. Friendly volunteers working there and lots of changing displays.
I thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful decorations, the by gone days of Christmas Past and the wonderful staff. I will be back to enjoy it one more time.

The Western Development Museum is a wonderful place to see for the artifacts and ways of life that our settlers experienced. There is something extra for various occasions that is sure to bring delight to everyone for wherever their interests lie and what they would like to do and experience. Lots of fun to be had, too. Boom Town and...
Quaint little restaurant in the museum very good food at a reasonable price! The museum is awesome lots to see beautiful cars and 1910 boom town is very cool!

Excellent field trip. Brought a group of 13 year Olds and they really enjoyed it. There is lots to see and learn about our history of transportation. There's a wide variety from motor cycles to planes and even a couple of old trains at the train station.
Very interesting to tour at your own speed with well explained displays. Continual additions keep the museum enjoyable for return visits.

Ok! Here is the thing! Saskatoon is not a big city and you can't expect a big museum like the natural history museum or even the ripleys museum! But then again this one is good enough! It has collected history and culture of the prairie region! Its good for families with children as they can enjoy the most ! It...

If you love machines and you are able to roam through the dozens they have on display at the WDM, you will be in absolute heaven in this place. I loved all the different tractors they have on display - it took hours to get through this place. It was not likely my wife's favourite place but - hey, I...

Wonderful venue! took my grandson to the Minions Dance Party there - also got to see the Festival of Trees - lots of Christmas activities going on! I enjoyed the variety of decorated trees and he enjoyed the train, the (special event) dance party and the interactive pieces of history. We also got to sample some delicious food in the...
A great perspective on early prairie life. Lots of interactive displays for all ages. Well worth visiting!

I go every year during the prairie railroad show. A art from the train show the museum is second to none. There are so many great exhibits that are well done. Recent addition made this place twice as large.
We have an annual family pass and we go at least once a month. It's a great way to spend a cold or rainy day out with the kids. We especially love the train displays.

One of the best museums to see with your children or grandchildren. They will be amazed and fascinated by life in the early days of Saskatchewan as depicted in Boomtown. Displays depicting the arrival of emigrants to the prairies and the lifestyle that developed over the last 100 years will captivate youngsters and adults. By the way, stop for a...

I have been many times. When ever I have guests visiting, I take them. Its like walking into the past. Exceptionally well done. I took friends from Nova Scotia. They said it was the high light of their visit.Great for young and old. Men and woman.

I have been going here since I was young and nothing has changed, and I don't know if that's a good or bad thing. There aren't many activities or things to do, but the main stretch is my favourite. I enjoy when they have the festival of trees during Christmas.

This museum is a great reflection of Saskatchewan's past. It is wonderfully maintained and staffed friendly people always willing to answer questions. They have a blacksmith shop that is fully functional and one can purchase their creations. One blacksmith was making a custom knife for a chef-it was amazing watching him forge it. We loved learning from them. My son...

The WDM in Saskatoon is unique just like the other WDM's in Saskatchewan and definitely my second favourite only to Moose Jaw. The kids love how you can get up close and learn and see so closely the details of what things were like for people so long ago. The opportunity to actually sit on some displays is awesome.
I take my dad here for breakfast a lot. Service is fast and friendly. Pancakes and oatmeal are particularly tasty.
A must see in Saskatoon. My son gets us to take him there 3 or 4 times a year! Great staff and totally authentic buildings and automobiles. Great annual train show as well!
Love this museum - the best in the city! Be sure to have lunch in the cafe - best cinnamon buns around.

This was a wonderful trip back in time. Great displays which interested the men and women both. Lots of cool places for photo ops including in the train engine. A relaxing museum with the fun of the hunt for a robber included.
Full of fun and excitements.Nice re-make and you feel like live in 18th century when you there.Love to go again.

We have been to the WDM many times and different seasons. My oldest is now 13 and she still enjoys going to the museum. It has something for everyone and is still exciting even the 10th and 11th time!The Christmas exhibit is my absolute favourite.

A very interesting and wonderful place to visit. It has a great turn of the 20th century town built in timely inside to tour and explore at your own speed. It has a large display of bygone farm machines and steam engines. Also there are a few old cars, for car buffs. The restaurant serves great food, especially the home...

We took friends from Arizona who liked it so much they wanted to go back for another day. Very interesting indoor display of what life was like in the years around 1910 when Saskatoon was being settled. Highly recommended.
We were lucky enough to be there for Pioneer Days and had a great time! We would have enjoyed the museum even if this special event weren't going on. The museum and staff are wonderful and fun!
Very reasonably priced and you could spend a lot of time checking the exhibits.It is clean and very well presented.

It is a great place to see how the lives used to be lived when the old country side was beginning. From the way we lived on the prairies and the start of the new farm equipment to the beginning of the automobile. The trains that brought most folks to our region and the stores and offices that we originally...
Must be seen. The other 3 WDMs are also great places to visit. Unfortunately they aren't as friendly or interesting to the newest generation which must plug in for everything or it isn't true.

If I visit the Museum once or one hundred times I will never tire of taking a step into the past and enjoying the wide variety of items from the past! What an experience! Just taking a grand parent along or older family member will make the visit even more exciting as they reminisce of stories about items and places...
A carefully preserved part of Saskatchewan history...well displayed and informative.We have enjoyed the changes made here over the years as well.

Wonderful, comfortable place to spend an afternoon. Not to be rushed through. Excellent nostalgia experience for older people as well as great learning for younger folks. Restaurant is an attraction as is gift shop. An asset to Saskatoon and very well done. Some attractions change, such as Eatons Christmas vintage display.

wear comfy shoes as there is a lot of walkinglots to see , be sure to go at Christmas as they create old nursery rhymsthe gift shop is well stocked with a lot of treasures to buythere is a coffee shop with some foodwe found the buns stale and not that great for the priceso...

I haven't been here since 1999 and I can honestly say I was pleasantly surprised. I actually went twice during the Festival of Trees with my family. The displays were informative and the audio effects were a nice touch. The restaurant was cafeteria style with many options. I was pleasantly surprised how good the hamberger and hot dogs were.
I found this museum very interesting and super surprised to see all these old vehicles in there and it gives you a good look at the past how things were!

This museum honestly goes on forever, and it's all fascinating. I thought it was more of a kids attraction, but I was wrong. A wonderful place to visit. Took my father and he connected immediately with the displays, the photographs and images and the theme.
A very interesting museum with a Saskatchewan historical town built indoors & several other high quality historical exhibits that will appeal to the whole family.
Boy if you what to see what it was like back in the day this is the place for you. How did we ever get by with out all the electronical devices ?

The museum is wonderful. The streetscape with all of the shops, the displays and history is wonderful and can be enjoyed year around as it is located inside. The history of the natives, the immigrants, and how they coped, and prospered is amazing. Highly recommend!

This place will bring you bace in time as you look at the way your forfathers had to make a living. You will find yourself lost in time with equipment and cooking things that were used and thought as the greatest stuff. Today we come them all...antique.You will be glad you stoped by.

This place is great to visit on a rainy/ cold day because it is all indoors. Love boom town :) it's one of my sons (he's 2) favourite places to visit. Lots of culture and artifacts here. Plus the gift shop is great too
Go every year because it changes and there is always things you missed before. Even if you spend your entire life in Saskatchewan you'll love the WDM.

If you are of my age (old) and grew up in the prairies, you will recognise many displays, buildings and equipment. If you are not from here, or you are but are young, you will see how things were on main street small town Saskatchewan 100 years ago (more or less). The old drug store even smells like the one...
It was really awesome , we had a great time . Everyone was really helpful and really friendly . I would tell everyone to go , you learn lots while having fun.

We stopped here on a trip to Saskatoon to visit family. The museum was interesting and nothing like a stuffy city museum. You walk into a prairie town from the early 1900's. You walk through the town and visit the many shops and businesses. My kids enjoyed every minute and we spent at least 2 hours here. I felt like...

WDM puts on a great evening of entertainment and treats. The kids all looked super in their costumes (and some adults too). Many of the kids were very interested in the various building displays of days gone by. The WDM is a great place to visit any time of the year.

During a recent trip to Saskatoon we stopped to visit Boomtown, which is a "real" street indoors that recreates a Saskatoon commercial street in 1910. Boom town is wonderful! Walking down the street of historic town is such an education for all ages! Festival of Trees in December transforms that street into a winter wonderland. This is an excellent place to go as a family, winter or summer. Something for everyone. Also the gift shop is full of exciting finds that you can't find anywhere...

Loved Boom Town and the dioramas to put things in context. The ability to walk through time to the present was fun. The old machinery, vehicles and especially the steam locomotive were incredible!! Stopped by for a quick tour with a friend from Ontario, and didn't have nearly enough time. Could have used a full day to browse around. Although...
We decided to visit the museum and were very impressed. We spent 3 hours going through it and also had a old fashioned photo done there.

AWESOME museum! It had amazing displays that were very interactive and informative. The gift shop is full of fun/cute things as well. My favourite items were the train and sod house. Great for all ages!
There is lots to see. Depending on the day and season, there are activities for the kids. There are added interactive displays and many things one can climb on and get into.

This place is amazing. They have an extensive display of memorabilia set against the background of a Main Street of a century ago. Great classic car and farm equipment displays. Very interesting. Allow at least two hours to see everything. Definitely kid friendly. Nice little cafe with great soups.

A great place to experience our history of Saskatoon and Saskatchewan for everyone from 3 to 90!! Kids will have fun running and exploring while seniors will reminesce about "the good old days"! The restaurant and gift shop are great places to take advantage of. A great place to take visitors!
Excellent option for meetings or social activities. Unique atmosphere for mingling and conversation sparks. Being a charitable organization support assists a worthy community venue and operation.
Make sure you have 1-2hours to see everything. It shows a lot of early pioneer history with blacksmith shop, pharmacy, school rooms and more. The authentic steam locomotive is a must see as well
We went there to see the festival of trees and the decorations in the museum were fantastic great time of year to go

This past weekend I took my Scout Troop to the Western Development Museum to try out the new digital scavenger hunt game. The scavenger hunt interacts with the players through text messages as visitors wind their way through Boomtown. The hunt for clues takes you to the most popular buildings. Took visitors from Germany and enjoyed the visit. The back area, which can be easily missed or overlooked, was great. The history through time to present day was fantastic.
This place is great! We have been here a couple of times...there is a lot to see. Love the way they have the old town set up
Lots of great displays and items on display. Lots of info about history of prairie life. A well kept museum overall, but video was not working.

The Boomtown exhibit was interesting but a little one-note; I must preferred the Prairie Life exhibit, which follows a single family through their emigration to Canada and establishment in the Prairies. Very well done, sadly I ran out of time and couldn't see the whole exhibit.
Take this attraction in if you are into history and the feel of old times. Very cool place to explore as there much to see.
This is an incredible place to visit. There is so much to see and so much to learn. The restaurant in boomtown is fabulous. Can't wait to go again.

A few years ago I got an annual pass when I was on maternity leave with my second child. It was a very cold winter and having this pass meant that I took my 3 year old son often to explore while my infant was sleeping in a stroller.
A great place to discover the history of Saskatchewan! Lots of artifacts as well as displays that are interactive. So much information!

If you take you time and go through everything, you will come away with far more knowledge than you went in with. Immigration, treatment of native peoples, types of vehicles used (farm, train to private transportation), the story of a family that immigrated to Sask. was very interesting. This is worth a visit if you're in Saskatoon. There are some great exhibits and it makes for a fun couple of hours.
Great place to enjoy a breakfast on the weekend. Buffett style with generous portions. Old school restaurant feel. A place frequented with many regular patrons.
We always go and walk through Boom Town. We take the grand children and go exploring. They all love it

Took my octogenarian parents, my sister who works for a Metis organization, and my nephew to the Western Development Museum. My Dad could have stayed and reminisced for much longer. My mother and sister loved the well presented history. My nephew was enthralled by the train and the farm equipment. And we all enjoyed a great lunch at the cafe.

Interesting museum about life on the prairies in the early 1900's. Good for all ages. They have a main street set up inside with many old buildings. They also a locomotive and vintage cars which were big hit with the kids. When we were they had horse drawn stage coach rides and a blacksmith shop working outside.
Very interesting Main Street and a great collection of items!Our overseas visitors enjoyed it very much, and we were very impressed with the layout of the museum.
No Horse rides for adults like it said in the program ,Needed more volunteers to help out at that event.
They did a good job. The old farm equipment and lesson in the part o Canadian history was neat...and interesting. Good collection of antique cars. Main Street was done up very well.

Went to the museum specifically to find an old piece of machinery that had been part of my husbands family. Went later on a Sunday afternoon when there was very few people there, which was great. I returned after 30 years. It has realy developed! Very exiting with children. It us very enjoyable on a rainy day. We had a great time!

I enjoyed the the way the main street in town was set up circa 1910. The static and interactive displays, make you appreciate the hard work and times for the farmer's families. It's a good way to spend the day, they have a cafe so you can take a break then go back to touring.

I loved taking a tour of the museum. I loved the old machinery and seeing the way that people lived "back in the day". We especially love it at Christmas when the whole building is decorated and they have the parade of trees...I would suggest that anyone visiting our beautiful city should check it out! My husband and I chose the WDM as the venue for our wedding reception after we had a great experience with his brother's wedding a few years earlier.The staff at the WDM were amazing - very helpful and accommodating, easy to work with, and made sure we had everything we needed to make our day go smoothly.The food...

Our family enjoyed several interesting hours visiting this delightful museum. There was plenty of hands-on moments to keep even our youngest family members exploring and learning. The wide variety of historically interesting period rooms, buildings and pieces available to enjoy is amazing, We look forward to our next visit. Excellent historic recreation of a main street from a community a hundred years ago. Farm machinery from decades past. Classic Auto collection. Something for everyone here. Excellent place to go on a rainy day.

The Saskatoon WDM explores daily life on the prairies. When you enter the exhibit area you walk on to the Main St of a 1910 Boomtown. This is an excellent museum of Saskatchewan history. Little shops line the indoor street. They host permanent exhibits as well as travelling shows relative to Canadian history. Nice gift shop as well.

Great Museum with Lots of items to learn from, interactive on most and very rare and unique items the whole family will enjoy to see. The antique items are exciting and humbling to see. We first visited this museum 15 years ago and it has not changed at all. There are lots of artifacts to look at. The Boomtown mainstreet is well set up. Lots of antique cars. Great to take your families, learn lots in a fun way. You feel like you are living in the 1930s. Bring your cameras

When we are in Saskatoon, we take the family here. We love this place; its like stepping back in time. Its like getting a history lesson and you can wander around at all the different shops and houses without needing a tour guide. Western Development Museum is great to visit during the Christmas season.The old Eaton' window displays are a treat to view, even though I have seen them many times.You can not beat the Festival of trees to get into the spirit of the season.If you are a vintage car fan, you will be glad for the visit.Wonderful...
It looks like it's one of these small museums you go trough within an hour. We spent 2h and haven't seen all yet. An amazing and very interesting exhibition. Worth several more visits.

Good selection in the gift shop for original Saskatchewan/Saskatoon gift ideas. One of the few shops that have the original tee shirts found in the airports for Meal on wheels, and bed and breakfast spoof shirts. A one of a kind gift idea.

Spent over 3 hours there and didn't see it all. My teen kids loved it and wanted to return the next day to see what they missed. Great value for the money. Family of 4 for $25...can't go wrong. Could even return the next day for free with receipt. Also can visit the other WDM in Saskatchewan for 1/2 price...
We have gone a number of times while living in Saskatoon. I think it's a must see for everyone interested in Saskatchewan history at least once.Festival of trees are also nice.

This is a really well organized museum with interesting displays relevant to Saskatchewan and Canada. There were a number of children there when we were there and they seemed to love it. And the cafe is a treat!
Besides from the Boomtown street, the museum also hosts a large variety of artifacts, hands on exhibits, and information panels. The history of Saskatchewan is also well covered off in the exhibits.

This could be an all day event for your family for sure.It is a reconstruction of 1900s prairie city, where people are in costume going about their daily business. This museum will depict life in the early days of city Saskatchewan in a unique and hands on approach. In addition to the history the restaurant provides daily meals that are affordable and delicious. A must see for all who visit our fair city.
Western Development Museum is one of the great places for everyone to go to learn about the history of our province. They have a great restaurant there too.

There are few places in Saskatoon worth visiting, WDM is one of them.You will see when and where your grandparents arrived to in IX/XX century, you will see agriculture machines you did not know about. There are smaller division speeded around Saskatchewan, I am sure you will be intrigued after visiting WDM.
This Museum entertains while educating. For all ages and interests. Complete wit a nice restaurant! Features events like steam show, etc.
A place that catch me everytime I visit. I have been there 4 times wiyh different family and always find something new! Very nice place for children to learn about the past!
Went here for a business supper and then had some free time to tour the museum.Excellent way to teach and learn about our history. It is all very well laid out.A must see if you visit Saskatoon!
Nice to go inside and escape the heat. Loved showing my children how their grandparents and great grandparents lived long ago!
It was fantastic to be able to bring my husband (new family) to an incredible piece of history I experienced as a child and now was able to see again through new eyes and with much pride.

This was a really neat place to visit it lets you look back in time how things were it even has a diner there to see be you meals and if you save your ticket you get a discount at the other museums like the one in Moose Jaw

My visit to the western development museum was an enjoyable experience I'm a fan of history and they certainly delivered it kept your interest and I learned a lot the price was good and the staff very friendly,helpful and knowledgeable I would highly recommend it

It gets better every time. I so love visiting this exceptionally well done museum. It litterally is the standard by which I've measured all others and it stands up so well. A very pleasant trip down memory lane.

The Western Development Museum is an amazing place that allows the viewer to step back in time, to the early part of the last century. This was a pivotal time of growth in the Prairies and ushered in major socio-cultural and economic change that came with the transition from primarily agriculture to an urban society. Our kids love visiting the Western Development Museum! They love all the buildings that they can go into and the volunteers that are there making the experience that much more enriching!

Regardless of the rainy weather in Saskatoon, our research indicated this was top of the list of places to visit. We ran into bad weather for our Saskatoon visit and needed a place to hang with our friends. It was a very comprehensive look at our pioneer past and made me appreciate our history.
It reflects the farm heritage of Saskatchewan and is worth the visit. It can take more than one visit to enjoy the entire museum.

A collection of old vehicles, trains and other farm machinery that is not something I would miss if I don't visit. It depends on you. If you like this type of collections, I encourage you not to miss visiting this place.

If you have a few hours to kill, take a cab to this wonderful museum. A walk down 1905 memory lane...on Main Street...with all of the shops to go into....not to buy stuff, but to see what it looked like back then.Many old cars, and wagons. Some absolutely enormous farm machinery and locomotives to see, too.Very cool place.

Travelled without my kids and wish they could have come too. This place was amazing and a must do if you're staying in or passing through Saskatoon. I had the fortune of attending a meeting here, they catered a lunch on an indoor patio that overlooks the historic recreated main street. Very interesting being able to enter most buildings. If you go ask someone about the pharmacy almost blowing up, and the bomb squad being called (insider info).
We spent several hours touring the museum and the presentations were awesome. I would highly recommend a visit if you are in Saskatoon.

We took advantage of the Saskatoon Experience Pass offered from our the Home Inn and Suites. This allowed our family free access. The museum is a great depiction of past times. Fun for ages 3-30 in our group.

I was in Saskatoon for a conference and one of the evening events was dinner at the Western Development Museum. The food was good (pyrohy/perogies and cabbage rolls). The displays were all very well done and the best thing was the enthusiasm of the volunteers telling the stories behind all the artifacts in the "building". If you enjoy history and...

Went to visit with relatives from England and anticipated a visit lasting an hour. How wrong we were the visit lasted 3 hours and we could have spent more time there on the vast variety od displays. We all agreed that it was the highlight of the day trip

indoor, climate controlled so comfortable for all. realistic view of early western Canadian town life. general store, Indian motorcycles, even a realistic funeral parlour. very interesting for an hour or two.

Our out of country guests thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this museum. The little town (indoors) represents so well the turn of the 20th century in old saskatchewan. The Western Development museum is a great place to go on a rainy day, with the whole family. From Grnadma and Grandpa to the youngest, everyone will enjoy a day exploring what life was like on the Prairies many years ago. Everything is well presented and interesting. Fun for everyone.
Surprisingly good food in the Cafe AND the Museum is pretty cool especially for antique car buffs or those with an interest in early Prairie urban life
This is a really interesting place to visit. Will bring back some memories to some of the way things were along time ago.

This museum is a walk through time from original Main Street Saskatoon through the settlers coming in by train, growth of farming, the dust bowl and right up to the present. An informative experience with lots to see of interest for all ages. A trip through history which everyone should see to help understand how the Province grew. I would highly recommend a visit. The restaurant within the museum is also excellent for lunch or a snack offering a good variety of food and drinks at very reasonable prices.

This museum gives the perfect overview of the settling and early developement of the western Canadian prairies. A huge selection of farm equipment automobiles and every material thing that made up prairie life! The highlight of this museum is of course a full scare main street of a Saskatchewan town. Know as Boomtown this is a DO NOT MISS place...
Interesting and informative. Very relaxing to walk thrugh on our own. Staff were friendly and helpful.

This is great place to spend a few hours. Learn about Saskatchewan and it's agricultural past. This museum, dedicated to Transportation it has wonderful car , farm tractor and railway collections. Garth Brooks brought us to Saskatoon for two of his shows and with having some down time between shows we were looking for something to do. Very well displayed items representing the history and heritage of Saskatchewan and prairie life. Super collection of old automobiles and farm equipment, displayed in great sets. Always changing, this museum is a great learning experience for families and kids.

This a great spot to see in saskatoon. Has so much to offer from the classic cars, farm equipment, Historic street which is really well put together and a walk through a life of someone moving to Saskatoon at the turn of the centuryDefinitely check this place out

This museum has been here a long time. A good tourist hot spot for a half day or so, the library is tricky as you need to plan ahead and ask when you can access. overall a great place just like the WDM in North Battleford.

This place is so amazing when you open the door and step back in time. The setup and the history that is provided is wonderful. You can spend hours here roaming through the town and enjoying all the different sections on what has occurred over time in Saskatchewan and Canada. I am an absolute sucker for everything historical, so upon discovering the WDM on a recent trip to Saskatoon, I knew I had to visit.WDM did NOT disappoint!
